title: 'Baby, I love you': Shocking details in Delhi 'godman' case; deleted chats under lens
content: A 21-year-old Delhi student has accused Chaitanyananda Saraswati, head of an institute, of persistent sexual harassment. The FIR details inappropriate WhatsApp messages and coercive behavior. Saraswati, already facing multiple charges including fraud and molestation from previous incidents, is currently on the run as police investigate these new allegations, including claims he targeted vulnerable students with promises and threats.

title: Odd flight path: Netanyahu's plane gives Europe wide birth; here's why
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's flight to the UN General Assembly took a circuitous route, avoiding several European nations possibly due to outstanding arrest warrants issued by the ICC for alleged war crimes. This comes as several European countries have recently recognized Palestinian statehood, a move strongly opposed by Netanyahu.

title: Karnataka caste survey: HC declines to interfere; asks to make participation voluntary
content: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the state's caste survey to proceed. The court mandated that participation must be voluntary. Authorities are barred from disclosing participant data. The survey aims to record the socio-economic status of all castes in Karnataka. The survey experienced a slow start due to technical glitches. Enumerators faced issues with the mobile application and network connectivity.

title: Ba***ds of B'wood row: Wankhede sues Aryan Khan; alleges damage to reputation
content: Sameer Wankhede has filed a defamation suit in Delhi high court against Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment, Netflix, and others over Aryan Khan’s directorial debut series, alleging it damages his reputation and undermines anti-drug enforcement agencies. Wankhede seeks damages of Rs 2 crore and a restraint on the show's streaming, claiming it misrepresents events and violates national honor laws.

title: H1-B visa hike: US largest business lobby may file lawsuit
content: The US Chamber of Commerce is contemplating legal action against the Trump administration's newly announced $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas, a move that has triggered anxiety among Indian and other foreign professionals in the US.

title: Ba***ds of B'wood row: Who is Sameer Wankhede? All about his link to Aryan Khan
content: Sameer Wankhede, the former NCB director, has filed a lawsuit in Delhi High Court against Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood,' and Red Chillies Entertainment. Wankhede alleges the series portrays him falsely and defames anti-drug enforcement agencies. He seeks a permanent injunction, declaration of defamation, damages of Rs 2 crore, and a restraint on the series' streaming.

title: Exclusive | ‘50 was equal to 100 at Oval’: Karun Nair reacts to India snub
content: Karun Nair's hopes for an India Test recall have been dashed as he was excluded from the squad for the West Indies series, despite a strong domestic season. Nair expressed disappointment, highlighting his fifty in the final Test against England. He made it clear that moving forward, he's just going to play in the Ranji Trophy.

title: IND-PAK row: PCB, BCCI trade complaints with ICC - what we know so far
content: Tensions surrounding the Asia Cup have escalated as the PCB and BCCI formally engaged the ICC over player conduct. The PCB complained about Suryakumar Yadav's remarks dedicating India's win to victims of the Pahalgam attack, alleging political undertones. The BCCI retaliated, filing a complaint against Pakistan's Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan for provocative gestures.

title: US may lose AI race to China, warns Google’s ex-CEO
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt cautioned that the US might lose the AI race to China, citing China's focus on applying AI across various sectors. He highlighted China's open-source approach to AI models, contrasting it with the US's emphasis on closed systems.

title: Asia Cup: Gambhir’s 3-word war cry goes viral; India into final
content: India secured their spot in the Asia Cup final with a dominant 41-run victory over Bangladesh, highlighted by Gautam Gambhir's celebratory social media post. Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75 off 37 balls set the stage for India's 168/6, while Kuldeep Yadav's 3/18 restricted Bangladesh to 127. India will now face either Pakistan or Bangladesh in the final.

title: Mega defence deal: Centre inks Rs 62K cr pact for 97 Tejas jets; big boost for IAF
content: The Defence Ministry has signed a significant deal with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited. The agreement involves procuring 97 LCA Mk1A aircraft for the Indian Air Force. This includes 68 fighter jets and 29 twin-seaters. Deliveries are expected to begin in 2027-28. The project emphasizes indigenous content and advanced systems. It will boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

title: Wayanad Congress turmoil: DCC chief quits after Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's visit
content: N D Appachan resigned as Wayanad DCC president amid internal conflicts, leaving his fate to the KPCC's decision. This move follows Priyanka Gandhi's constituency visit and a period of factionalism within the Wayanad Congress. The party has also faced controversy due to recent suicides and a suicide attempt linked to local leaders.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
content: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: Ex-French prez gets 5-yr jail term: Convicted for criminal conspiracy; what is Libya case
content: A Paris court found Nicolas Sarkozy guilty of criminal conspiracy. He was acquitted of corruption charges related to alleged illegal funding from Libya. The trial involved claims of Moamer Kadhafi's support for Sarkozy's 2007 campaign. Two aides were convicted, while another was acquitted. The ruling occurred after the death of a key accuser.

title: Ladakh protest: Farooq urges Centre to initiate talks; warns of China threat
content: Farooq Abdullah urged the Centre to engage in dialogue with Ladakh's residents to address their concerns, highlighting China's presence in the region. He dismissed claims of external instigation behind recent protests, attributing them to unmet promises of statehood and the Sixth Schedule.

title: NHL: Lauren Kyle, Celeste Desjardins step out for girl date night
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Connor McDavid, enjoyed a girls' night out with Celeste Desjardins at her restaurant, Bar Trove, showcasing her fall fashion. Beyond nightlife, Kyle hosted a charity poker tournament supporting the Oilers Foundation's initiative to help children access youth sports. She balances style, social influence, and philanthropy, establishing herself as a prominent figure in Edmonton.

title: 'Rampur, Mudhol': BSF turns to Indian dog breeds - what inspired shift?
content: Inspired by PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat', the BSF is training and deploying Indian dog breeds like Rampur Hound and Mudhol Hound along India's borders. Around 150 Indian breed dogs have been trained and deployed, adding to the 700 dogs already serving. Riya, a BSF-bred Indian dog, won the Best Tracker Dog award in 2024, showcasing their capabilities.

title: 'Could hurt India': Bumrah’s workload management sparks fresh debate
content: Mohammad Kaif sparks discussion on Jasprit Bumrah's role in limited overs cricket. Selectors name Bumrah in the Test squad against West Indies. Ajit Agarkar confirms Bumrah is fit and ready. Devdutt Padikkal replaces Karun Nair in the squad. Sai Sudharsan is likely to play at No.3. Ravindra Jadeja will be the vice-captain.

title: Big relief for taxpayers as CBDT extends last date to file audit report- check details
content: The CBDT has extended the deadline for submitting tax audit reports for the financial year 2024-25 to October 31, 2025, providing relief to taxpayers. This decision follows representations from professional associations citing difficulties in completing audits due to floods and other disruptions.

title: Is London the ‘Sharia capital’? Decoding Donald Trump’s UNGA broadside
content: Trump’s claim is legally baseless: English law remains supreme. But it resonates because it amplifies very real failures and contradictions in Britain’s handling of religion, justice, and integration.

title: H-1B turns pricier: Germany woos Indian talent; time to pivot?
content: Germany seeks Indian professionals due to US visa changes. The US increased H-1B fees, affecting tech workers. Ambassador Ackermann invites Indians to Germany's tech, management, and science sectors. Germany plans to issue many professional visas, including for Indian nationals. Germany offers stable migration policies and good job prospects. This shift may alter where Indian professionals seek work abroad.

title: 4 police teams, multiple cities — Khedkar family split, in disguise to evade arrest
content: A massive search is underway for dismissed IAS officer Pooja Khedkar and her family after they allegedly kidnapped and wrongfully confined a truck helper following a road rage incident in Navi Mumbai. The family has been missing since September 15, prompting police to issue Look Out Circulars to prevent their escape from the country.

title: ‘Tujhe maarke jail bi jaana pade toh jaunga': Uber driver threatens women in Noida
content: An Uber cab driver in Noida was arrested after allegedly abusing and threatening a group of women passengers following a disagreement over the route. The driver reportedly brandished a pipe and threatened the women after they asked him to take an underpass to avoid traffic.

title: Watch: Gwalior man pulls out gun when told not to urinate in public
content: A roadside urination incident in Gwalior escalated into a dangerous confrontation when a man allegedly brandished a revolver at a street cart vendor family. The dispute began after the vendors objected to the public indecency. The man, after exchanging heated words with the family, allegedly threatened them with the firearm, causing them to flee.

title: Stopped from thrashing wife, drunk man bludgeons father to death with cricket bat
content: In Gurgaon, a 42-year-old man, Neeraj, fatally attacked his 75-year-old father, Gulab Singh, with a cricket bat and steel container after the father intervened to stop him from assaulting his wife, Preeti. Neeraj, who was inebriated, was arrested after Preeti's statement revealed a history of harassment and the events leading to the tragic death. Police are investigating the murder.

title: Kuwait sees over 2,600 divorces in 2025 amid surge in early marital breakdowns
content: Between January and July 2025, Kuwait recorded over 2,600 divorces, including a sharp rise in early marital breakdowns and 222 khula cases initiated by women. Notably, 287 divorces occurred before consummation. In response, the Ministry of Justice is expanding reconciliation centers and launching awareness campaigns to address rising divorce rates and promote family stability across the country.

title: India Test squad: New vice-captain named for West Indies
content: India announced their 15-member squad for the two-Test series against West Indies, with Ravindra Jadeja named vice-captain and Devdutt Padikkal included. Karun Nair was dropped due to unmet expectations. Shubman Gill leads India in their first home series of the 2025-2027 World Test Championship cycle. Khary Pierre earned his maiden Test call-up for the West Indies.

title: Ladakh violence: Section 163 imposed in Kargil; shops shut, streets empty
content: In response to a shutdown call by the Kargil Democratic Alliance, authorities in Kargil imposed Section 163, prohibiting gatherings of more than four people. Shops and businesses remained closed as locals protested, expressing solidarity and concern over a recent incident in Leh. KDA leader Sajad Kargili urged peaceful protest and dialogue. Dr.

title: A first for Indian cricket: Ashwin joins Sydney Thunder, to play in BBL next season
content: R Ashwin, the veteran Indian off-spinner, is set to make history as the first male Indian player in the Big Bash League, joining the Sydney Thunder for BBL 15. Following his international and IPL retirement, the 39-year-old aims to bolster the Thunder's campaign, bringing leadership and connecting with Western Sydney's Indian community.

title: Kylie Kelce reveals parenting advice that annoys her most while balancing personal life
content: Kylie Kelce, mother of four, humorously addresses the complexities of traveling with children on her podcast. She highlights the unrealistic expectations of casually bringing babies along, emphasizing the extensive planning involved. From packing portable cribs and endless supplies to navigating strollers and car seats, Kelce points out the mental and physical load parents bear.

title: US senator urges end to student work permits: Is OPT the next target?
content: Senator Chuck Grassley urges DHS to end work permits for student visa holders, citing competition with Americans and national security risks. His call targets OPT, a key program allowing international students to gain post-graduation work experience. The move could significantly affect Indian students, the largest group in the US, potentially limiting pathways to STEM employment and impacting higher education and H-1B visa prospects.

title: ‘Bank accounts wiped out': Karisma Kapoor’s kids make big claim; HC hears Sunjay Kapur case
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur has approached the Delhi High Court seeking to file details of her late husband Sunjay Kapur's assets in a sealed cover, amidst a partition suit filed by Karisma Kapoor and her children. Citing cybersecurity risks, Priya proposed an NDA or a 'Confidentiality Club'.

title: 'India should have shaken hands with Pakistan': Tharoor on handshake row
content: Amidst Asia Cup tensions, Shashi Tharoor advocates separating sports from politics, recalling past instances of India-Pakistan matches during conflict. The BCCI have lodged a complaint against Pakistani players for provocative actions, including gestures referencing military clashes. Pakistan's board retaliated with a complaint against Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Was Ladakh violence incited by comparisons to Nepal? Wangchuk says youths lost limbs
content: In Ladakh, four protesters died and 58 were wounded after security forces allegedly fired on demonstrators demanding Sixth Schedule protections and statehood. The violence, the first since Ladakh became a Union territory in 2019, erupted after hunger strikers collapsed, prompting mass protests. Activist Sonam Wangchuk condemned the police action, while officials cited stone-throwing by protesters and damage to property.

title: BJP sounds poll bugle: Polls in-charges named for Bihar, TN & Bengal
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has strategically appointed key leaders as poll in-charges for the upcoming elections in Bihar, Tamil Nadu, and West Bengal. Dharmendra Pradhan will lead the charge in Bihar, supported by co-incharges CR Paatil and Keshav Prasad Maurya.

title: Will the H1B visa fee hike finally keep India’s IIT talent at home?
content: The US H1B visa fee hike to $100,000 has sparked concerns over global talent mobility, with Yale scholar Gautam Mukunda warning it risks losing top IIT graduates. For India, this policy shift presents a unique opportunity to retain its brightest engineers, strengthen startups, expand research capacity, and transform brain drain into a catalyst for domestic innovation and global competitiveness.

title: Fujiwhara Effect: How Atlantic storms Humberto and 94L could threaten US East Coast
content: Tropical Storm Humberto and Invest 94L are drawing closer in the Atlantic, raising the possibility of a rare Fujiwhara Effect. This interaction could significantly alter the storms' paths and intensities, complicating forecasts for the US East Coast. Meteorologists are closely monitoring the systems, as the effect can lead to unpredictable rotations and potential landfall scenarios, demanding vigilance from coastal communities.

title: Hand over mobile as ‘security’ for stretcher at Delhi's LNJP, wheel it yourself
content: Delhi's Lok Nayak Hospital requires patients to surrender their mobile phones as security for stretchers due to shortages and theft concerns. Patients expressed distress over being unreachable during emergencies, while hospital staff defended the practice, citing difficulties in monitoring stretchers amidst a high patient volume and porous security.

title: India drop Karun Nair for West Indies Test matches - here's why
content: Shubman Gill will lead India's 15-member Test squad against the West Indies, with Ravindra Jadeja as vice-captain. Ajit Agarkar announced the squad, revealing Karun Nair's exclusion due to underwhelming performance in England. Sai Sudharsan and Devdutt Padikkal received call-ups. Agarkar cited Padikkal's recent form and prior Test squad experience as factors.

title: Raleigh joins the 60 home run club! A monthly breakdown of the historic campaign
content: The Mariners slugger just joined an elite club with his 60th homer. Here's a look back at the road that got him here.

title: Raleigh hits Nos. 59, 60 as M's clinch AL West
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh is two shy of tying the AL record after becoming the seventh player in major league history to hit 60 home runs in a season.

title: Guardians overtake Tigers with historic surge
content: The Guardians became the first MLB team to overcome a deficit of 15½ games and take the lead in either division or league play after beating the Tigers to take a one-game edge in the AL Central.

title: Judge reaches 50 HRs, tying record, then adds 51
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge tied a major league record held by Babe Ruth, Mark McGwire and Sammy Sosa by reaching 50 home runs for the fourth time.

title: Phils seal 1st-round bye behind team-record 8 HRs
content: The Phillies bashed a team-record eight home runs, including three from Edmundo Sosa, and wrapped up a first-round bye in the playoffs with an 11-1 win over the Marlins.

title: Hawk skateboard from famed 900 draws $1.15M
content: The skateboard Tony Hawk used to land an unprecedented 900 in competition has sold for around $1.152 million at auction, about double the presale estimate.

title: IU's Moore wins eligibility suit, can play rest of '25
content: Indiana starting safety Louis Moore is eligible to play the rest of the 2025 season after a judge ruled the NCAA's five-year eligibility rule violated the Texas Antitrust Act.

title: SEC loses few annual rivalries, but coaches 'get it'
content: Under the new SEC scheduling format, some longstanding rivalries will no longer be annual affairs -- such as LSU-Alabama, LSU-Florida and Tennessee-Georgia.

title: Cup banter starts as Donald lands ceremony quips
content: With matches still two days away, the Ryder Cup gamesmanship began when European captain Luke Donald took a few jabs on pay-for-play at the opening ceremony.

title: With six NFL teams at 0-3, which one needs a win most? Our experts weigh in
content: The Giants are going with Jaxson Dart at QB as history shows the difference between 1-3 and 0-4 is drastic for playoff hopes.

title: Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, and Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta.

title: From sketchbook to spotlight: The life cycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: Week 5 preview: Georgia-Alabama, key conference matchups, plus quarterbacks to know
content: Big conference matchups, quarterbacks that are making a name for themselves and more ahead of Week 5.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: The Seahawks underwent an offensive makeover in one offseason -- is it working?
content: The Seahawks have a new QB in Sam Darnold, new receivers and a new scheme, thanks to coordinator Klint Kubiak.

title: Cardinals QB Kyler Murray makes key adjustment in his seventh season
content: Murray has learned to take what's available instead of forcing long throws, and it's making a difference.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 4
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: 'The people love him': Bryson DeChambeau is one of the main characters at this Ryder Cup
content: Everyone seems to have an opinion on DeChambeau ahead of the 2025 Ryder Cup. But one thing is clear: His U.S. teammates expect him to have a big impact this week.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Inside Lane Kiffin's effort to alter the narrative of his polarizing career
content: One of college football's most polarizing figures, the Ole Miss coach opens up about changing his image.

title: Why clubs shouldn't freeze players out, like Chelsea are doing with Raheem Sterling
content: The trend of players having to train away from the first team -- like Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi -- is a reminder that clubs hold an unfair amount of leverage.

title: How a historic trade in February has helped shape the WNBA semifinals
content: The biggest trade in WNBA history happened last February. Now a player involved in that deal will win a WNBA title.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: What's it like for former Cowboys stars -- such as Micah, Emmitt, DeMarcus, Zeke -- to return to Dallas as an opponent
content: Micah Parsons will follow in the footsteps of Emmitt Smith, DeMarcus Ware and Ezekiel Elliott on Sunday as an opponent at AT&T Stadium.

title: Lost seasons, disastrous drafts and fans rooting for the visiting team: Inside the Rockies' road to rock bottom
content: As Colorado nears the finish of one of the worst seasons in MLB history. Here's why the decline was a long time coming.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool, Man United track Semenyo
content: Premier League clubs are lining up to battle for AFC Bournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Philadelphia 76ers unveil Iverson-era throwback uniforms
content: The uniform unveiling celebrates the 25th anniversary of the 76ers' Eastern Conference championship-winning team.

title: Trees are back: Timberwolves unveil KG-era throwback uniforms
content: From 1998 to 2008, Minnesota wore this look, making eight straight playoff appearances and a West finals run.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Sleepers and busts: Who to draft and who to avoid at current value
content: Here are the best fantasy hockey sleeper picks to draft, as well as which players to avoid at current rankings.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Sebastian confesses to killing Bindhu Padmanabhan, Crime Branch tells court
content: The CB stated that Sebastian confessed to murdering Bindhu during questioning in connection with the Jainamma murder case. He has been remanded in police custody till September 30.

title: ‘Karam’ movie review: A staid, emotionally-hollow film with nothing new to say
content: Humour depends on the setting as well as the timing, and Vineeth Sreenivasan’s particular attempt at comedy amid attempts to bust a human trafficking ring, fall flat

title: A noteworthy achievement for vocalist from Tiruchi
content: His drawing skills drew the attention of Microsoft’s Bill Gates, who gifted him a tablet PC and made him the brand ambassador of the MS Paint software in 2006.

title: Nainar Nagenthran accuses T.N. government of ‘deliberately delaying’ assistant professor appointments
content: In a statement, he said nearly 4,000 assistant professor posts remain vacant, while the State government has increased the number of guest lecturer posts to 8,000

title: 10 Maoists surrender before Jharkhand police in Chaibasa
content: The Maoists were influenced by the State government’s attractive surrender and rehabilitation policy and decided to join the mainstream, police said

title: VACB conducts raid on Kumbla grama panchayat
content: The VACB raids were conducted after allegations of building rule violations in the construction of Muliyadukkam Complex in Kumbla town

title: 2020 riots: Delhi High Court denies bail to Tahir Hussain in IB staffer murder case
content: The police had opposed Tahir Hussain's plea calling it a shocking case involving the brutal murder of a young intelligence officer

title: Inquiry launched as videos of man beating boy with belt at Coimbatore children’s home emerge
content: Two videos, which were widely circulated, showed a man beating a child with a belt in the presence of other inmates and a few caretakers

title: Government to take disciplinary action against officers skipping social and educational survey in Karnataka
content: The Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes commenced the social and educational survey on September 22 and it would end on October 7

title: Ladakh violence: Sonam Wangchuk says his imprisonment could cause more problems
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was reacting to the MHA's statement, which had blamed him for provoking the mob violence on September 24, 2025

title: Tourism Department issues guidelines to owners of resorts, hotels and home stays in Kodagu district of Karnataka
content: Owners have been told to compulsorily reside in the premises, interact with tourists and their travel plans, provide proper guidance and inform them about the local customs and laws

title: 13-year-old boy unleashes musical magic at Malappuram school
content: Adwaith M. Sree, a 13-year-old musical wizard from Kozhikode, wowed the students and teachers effortlessly playing five musical instruments: tabla, harmonium, beatbox, melodica, and keytar.

title: S.P. Venkateshwaran will replace G.K. Mani as PMK floor leader: Anbumani to T.N. Assembly Speaker
content: Mr. Anbumani, in a letter, stated that a decision on replacing the floor leader was taken unanimously in a meeting of PMK MLAs held in Panaiyur near Chennai on September 24

title: Meet Chef Karan Gokani of London’s Hoppers in Bengaluru
content: In a prelude to The Hindu Lit For Life, the Chef will be in conversation with restaurateur Sandesh Reddy as they decode the flavours of India, and talk about their personal journeys with food. Here is how to sign up

title: Centre should hold talks with the people of Ladakh: Farooq Abdullah
content: A day after Leh witnessed violence over statehood demands, former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah emphasised that Ladakh is a sensitive area

title: Ladakh violence: Crisis is BJP Govt's own creation, says Congress
content: Congress blames BJP for Ladakh crisis, calls for Sixth Schedule inclusion for dignity and identity protection

title: Adani Krishnapatnam Port achieves discharge rate of 61,500 MT in one day
content: “This accomplishment underscores the seamless coordination, dedication and teamwork of multiple departments,” AKPL Chief Executive Officer Jagdish Patel said

title: India’s first dugong reserve in Palk Bay gains global recognition at IUCN Congress
content: Established on September 21, 2022, by the Tamil Nadu government under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, the Dugong Conservation Reserve covers 448.34 sq. km. in northern Palk Bay

title: The Hindu Mind highlights: Telangana Dy CM Bhatti Vikramarka Mallu, Kerala FM K.N. Balagopal speak on GST 2.0
content: Mr. Mallu and Mr. Balagopal were two of the eight State Finance Ministers who had written to the GST Council asking it to compensate States for the revenue impact of the GST rate cuts

title: Government inks pact with HAL for procurement of 97 Tejas jets for IAF
content: Deliveries will start in 2027-28, boosting Indian Air Force capability, Atmarnirbhar Bharat and India’s defence preparedness

title: President Murmu reaches Mathura for day-long visit aboard special, luxury Maharaja Express train
content: According to a statement from the President's office, her itinerary is packed with visits to prominent holy sites

title: Ladakh Lieutenant Governor reviews security situation in Leh, calls for heightened vigilance
content: Officials said senior officers from the police, CRPF and civil administration attended the meeting and discussed in detail the prevailing law and order situation in the region

title: BJP announces election in-charges for Bihar, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu
content: Bihar Assembly elections are due in November 2025 while Tamil Nadu and West Bengal will go to polls in 2026

title: CAG finds 'serious loopholes' in Crime and Criminal Tracking Network System application in Odisha
content: The CAG has conducted an IT audit of the CCTNS to evaluate the performance and effectiveness of the system from its inception (2013) till March 2023

title: Allahabad High Court stays proceedings against Triple Talaq accused
content: The counsel for petitioners submitted that the applicants are Muslims belonging to Shia community, which do not practice Triple Talaq, or talaq-e-biddat

title: Leader of Opposition status: Andhra Pradesh HC to hear Jagan Mohan Reddy’s plea in four weeks
content: The former Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh argued that the ruling passed by the Speaker on February 5, 2025 on recognising him as LoP was illegal

title: Class 9 student taken in for questioning after attacking classmate with machete in Tirunelveli
content: The boy from the intermediate caste reportedly brought a machete to school and attacked an SC classmate who had allegedly made abusive remarks against the former’s father

title: Amrit Bharat Weekly Express begins maiden journey from Erode to Jogbani
content: The Erode-Jogbani-Erode Amrit Bharat Express will traverse seven States — Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar — covering 3,132 km

title: Accommodation for Arvind Kejriwal within 10 days: Centre assures Delhi High Court
content: Delhi High Court said AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal could approach the government again if dissatisfied with the residence allotted

title: In Memoriam | S.L. Bhyrappa (1931-2025)
content: Readers, writers and political leaders from across the ideological spectrum remember and pay tribute to one of Kannada’s most prolific and popular novelists.

title: Engineers in Odisha allegedly spent ₹149 crore of government funds for personal expenses, finds CAG
content: Instances of irrelevant transactions at commercial merchants’ locations, payment of utility bills, payments to e-commerce websites and payments towards investments in mutual funds and stock market made by engineers were traced

title: Supreme Court lifts Allahabad HC stay on 100-year-old Ramlila festivities at U.P. school playground, but asks State to find another spot in future
content: The Uttar Pradesh district administration has to identify alternative place to play Ramlila so that students have exclusive use of the playground, the Supreme Court observed

title: Uttar Pradesh traders, consumers will gain most from GST reforms: CM Yogi Adityanath
content: CM Yogi Adityanath engages directly with traders and customers at Hazratganj Market hailing the ‘Next Gen GST Reform’, implemented on the first day of Sharadiya Navratr

title: BJP MLA Ganesh Gaonkar elected Goa Assembly Speaker
content: Mr. Gaonkar polled 32 votes against his rival Congress candidate Altone D'Costa, who was supported by only seven MLAs

title: Tax burden to ease further as economy gains more strength: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi promises further tax relief, ongoing GST reforms, and emphasises self-reliance in India’s economic growth

title: GST procedure simplified after recent reforms by government of India: CGST Joint Commissioner
content: Belagavi Chartered Accountants’ Association President Veeranna Muragod said that GST is the best tax system in the world

title: Madhya Pradesh forms panel to probe electrocution of 2 children near Durga Puja pandal in Jabalpur
content: The incident occurred due to lighting decorations installed by the organisers outside the pandal without a proper electricity connection

title: Sengottaiyan denies meeting Dhinakaran, says Chennai visit was personal
content: Reaffirming his “loyalty” to the AIADMK, Mr. Sengottaiyan said his sole aim was to strengthen and unite the party

title: Cabinet approves ₹69,725 crore package to revitalise shipbuilding, maritime ecosystem
content: Under the package, the Shipbuilding Financial Assistance Scheme (SBFAS) will be extended until March 31, 2036, with a total corpus of ₹24,736 crore

title: Indian among 7 Buddhist monks killed in Sri Lanka monastery cable cart accident
content: The incident occurred on Wednesday (September 24) night at the Na Uyana Aranya Senasanaya, a renowned Buddhist monastery located in Nikaweratiya, about 125 km from Colombo

title: Curfew imposed in Ladakh after intense clashes; heavy security in towns, 50 detained
content: Officials said heavy deployment of police and paramilitary personnel in riot gear was made in Kargil, Zanskar, Nubra, Padam, Changtang, Drass and Lamayuru

title: Two militants, one arms dealer arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces have been conducting search operations in Manipur since ethnic violence broke out two years ago

title: Two Indians sanctioned by U.S. for trafficking fentanyl, other illicit drugs
content: The OFAC named Sadiq Abbas Habib Sayyed and Khizar Mohammad Iqbal Shaikh, who they claimed worked with traffickers in the Dominican Republic and the U.S. to distribute counterfeit drugs

title: Car catches fire on Mumbai’s Coastal Road, causes traffic jam briefly
content: About 30 minutes after the intimation, the city traffic police department said the traffic was cleared to return to normalcy on the route

title: Teaching job aspirants in West Bengal block TMC MP, MLA’s car; demand immediate recruitment, clash with police
content: Kolkata Court asks Minister of Correctional Administration Chandranath Sinha to appear before ED officials for questioning in the school recruitment scam

title: Liquor scam probe: ACB/EOW arrests ex-Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel's son Chaitanya
content: Chaitanya has been in judicial custody and lodged in a jail since his arrest by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on July 18 in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged liquor scam

title: GE Aerospace Foundation expands global STEM training initiative, to train 4,000 students in Bengaluru
content: GE expects the expansion of Next Engineers to Bengaluru to increase access to STEM education for students and grow the local engineering pipeline by inspiring and preparing the next generation of engineering leaders

title: Air Force use would’ve slowed Chinese offensive in 1962 war: Chief of Defence Staff Chauhan
content: Over the years, the security situation has changed and the face of warfare itself has got transformed, the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) maintained

title: Kolkata neighbourhoods, citizens, businesses reel under aftermath of flood in Kolkata
content: The city grapples with flooded streets, mounting damages, economic loss, and a looming threat of more rain

title: Intermediate Range Agni-Prime Missile successfully tested from rail-based mobile launcher system
content: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said “This next generation missile is designed to cover a range up to 2000 km and is equipped with various advanced features”

title: Community groups say U.P. ban on caste-based rallies hits mobilisation
content: Some of these outfits said the move may discourage increasing awareness of marginalised communities that are seeking representation and recognition in political and social circles

title: Monsoon withdraws from flood-ravaged Punjab, neighbouring Haryana
content: Flood-ravaged Punjab had received 253.7 mm of rain in August, which was not only 74% in excess of normal but also the highest the State witnessed in the past 25 years

title: Death penalty: SC to hear on October 8 Centre's plea for victim, society-centric guidelines
content: The Centre moved the application in the top court in January 2020 and contended the existing guidelines were only "accused and convict-centric"

title: The age of India’s leaders has steadily risen
content: The age profile of the Lok Sabha has shifted markedly over the decades, with the 18th Lok Sabha being the “oldest” yet

title: New $100k H1B visa fee could threaten Indian students’ American dream
content: Indians who recently became the largest group of foreign students could be priced out of the American job market

title: Heavy rain batters Odisha; IMD says more in store, districts on alert
content: The IMD issues orange warning of heavy to very heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning at one or two places over the districts of Koraput, Nawarangpur and Nuapada

title: Leh violence LIVE: Sonam Wangchuk says his imprisonment could cause more problems
content: Dozens were detained on Thursday in a crackdown on the suspects who participated in Wednesday’s protests in Leh

title: Vallabha Agraharam Street awaits civic upgrades amid daily hustle
content: Barely wide enough for two cars to pass at once, the lane is flanked by tightly packed residences, corner shops, tea stalls, and a row of small lodges that draw a steady stream of travellers

title: Delhi HC sets aside copyright order against A.R. Rahman in ‘Veera Raja Veera’ song case
content: The court’s ruling, which came on an appeal filed by Rahman, set aside the April order findings of infringement and financial liability against him

title: Motorist knocked down by speeding lorry on Anna Salai
content: Near the subway, the lorry belonging to Chennai Corporation rammed into his vehicle and dragged it for a few yards

title: Will AI help fix India’s energy demand or will its own needs surge?
content: A McKinsey report has estimated that the annual global demand for data centre capacity could rise at 19-22% from 2023 to 2030, reaching 171-219 GW, against the total current demand of 60 GW. To avoid a deficit, at least twice as much data centre capacity built since 2000 will have to be in place in less than a quarter of the time

title: We love India, want more energy trade with it: U.S. Energy Secretary
content: We want to expand our energy cooperation with India in natural gas and coal, in nuclear, in clean cooking fuels, liquid petroleum gas, India has been a star in that area. So we want nothing more than more trade, energy cooperation with India, says U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright

title: UNGA 80: Jaishankar holds bilateral talks with counterparts from Mexico, Cyprus, Pacific nations
content: India and Pacific Island countries are development partners. Our agenda is people-centric and focused on health, technology, capacity building and training, says External Affairs Minister

title: Language consultation panel passes resolution to dissolve committee on Maharashtra three-language policy
content: The Narendra Jadhav Committee was set up in June this year to review the policy and submit its report within three months after holding public consultations with stakeholders

title: 5 Years In Jail For Ex-French President Sarkozy Over Libya Funding Trial
content: A Paris court on Thursday convicted former French president Nicolas Sarkozy on charges of criminal conspiracy but acquitted him of corruption

title: She Fell, Baba Asked For X-Ray Reports, "Baby, I Love You" Messages Followed
content: The police probe into allegations of sexual harassment at a prominent educational and spiritual institution in New Delhi has widened, with disturbing new details surfacing against Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati.

title: Family Sent UP Man To Rehab. He Got Addicted To Eating Spoons, Toothbrushes
content: Toothbrushes, steel spoons and pens were retrieved from the stomach of a man at a de-addiction centre in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Suhel Seth Says Oxford Dictionary Shashi Tharoor's 'Sole Mate'. Banter Follows
content: A fresh banter over language has started between senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor and author-columnist Suhel Seth, after the latter referred to the Oxford dictionary as the Thiruvanthapuram MP's "sole mate".

title: Sonam Wangchuk's Journey From Real 'Phunsukh Wangdu' To Activist Under Lens
content: This celebrated figure is now at the centre of the unrest in Ladakh that left four people dead and nearly a 100 injured yesterday

title: 'Diddy' Back In Court In Bid To Reverse Sex-Trafficking Charges
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs is due to appear in court on Thursday for a hearing over his bid to set aside a jury's verdict finding the hip-hop mogul guilty on prostitution charges but clearing him of more serious counts of sex trafficking and racketeering.

title: Delhi Baba Who Faces Sexual Assault Charges Using Disguise To Evade Arrest: Sources
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati based, a Delhi-based self-styled godman who faces allegations of sexual harassment, is trying to evade arrest by disguising himself, police sources said.

title: Mentally Unsound Man Murdered By Inmates At Rehab In Hyderabad: Cops
content: A 38-year-old man undergoing treatment for "mental health issues" was murdered at a private de-addiction and rehabilitation centre here allegedly by two inmates following a quarrel over a minor issue, police said on Thursday.

title: Lt Col Purohit Promoted To Colonel After Acquittal In 2008 Malegaon Blast Case
content: Lieutenant Colonel Prasad Shrikant Purohit -- acquitted in 2008 Malegaon blast case -- has been promoted to the post of Colonel after years of legal battle.

title: Earn Miles While You Dine: Air India, Zomato Launch Loyalty Tie-Up
content: The tie-up integrates Air India's Maharaja Club loyalty programme with Zomato's food delivery platform

title: Boyfriend Of Charlie Kirk Killing Suspect Was Kicked Out Of His House: Report
content: The transgender live-in boyfriend of Tyler Robinson, the key accused in the killing of right-wing commentator Charlie Kirk, reportedly faced a turbulent home life during the later years of high school.

title: Video: SUV Gets Stuck In Sand At Maharashtra Beach. Then The Waves Come
content: A group of tourists narrowly escaped danger when their car was caught in strong waves and nearly got swept away into the Arabian Sea after they reportedly drove too close to the shoreline at a beach in Maharashtra.

title: Special Team Raids Houses Of Zubeen Garg's Event Organiser, Manager
content: Assam Police probing the death of cultural icon Zubeen Garg during the Northeast India Festival in Singapore last week raided at least three places, including one linked to the organiser, in Guwahati on Thursday.

title: 'Bangladesh Has Problems With India': Muhammad Yunus On Sheikh Hasina, SAARC Revival
content: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus courted controversy in New York, where he claimed Dhaka's ties with New Delhi are strained because India didn't like last year's student protests that led to the dramatic ouster of former PM Sheikh Hasina.

title: Operation Numkhor: Arunachal-Linked Land Cruiser Fuels Customs Probe Into Bhutan Car Smuggling
content: The Customs Preventive unit here, probing the suspected smuggling of used cars from Bhutan, is conducting a detailed investigation into a first-owned 1992-model Toyota Land Cruiser SUV registered in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan Given BJP's Bihar Election Charge
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has been made the BJP's in-charge for the upcoming Bihar elections that will test the Nitish Kumar-led NDA's resilience against the state's ingrained caste equations and the opposition's social justice push

title: Xi Jinping Steps Back From Global Stage As Premier Li Qiang Represents China At UN
content: Chinese Premier Li Qiang is speaking at this week's annual meeting in the latest example of President Xi Jinping cutting back on overseas trips and delegating tasks to loyal lieutenants.

title: Centre Plans Big Indus Gift For North India Ahead Of 2029 Elections
content: India is gearing up to make massive changes to the Indus River system to meet the water demands of the northern states.

title: CBI Probing Ladakh Activist Sonam Wangchuk's Foreign Funding, Pakistan Visit
content: The CBI has begun an investigation into alleged violation of Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act against an institution founded by educationist and activist Sonam Wangchuk, who was earlier on a hunger strike and is pressing for statehood for Ladakh

title: Charlie Kirk Could Become Youngest American To Appear On US Currency Under New House Proposal
content: Charlie Kirk may appear on US currency under a new House GOP proposal. Kirk, a fervent supporter and former aide of US President Donald  Trump, could be featured on special silver dollar coins.

title: Silent Hill f review -- A stunning comeback for the horror series
content: Silent Hill f is the best horror game in the series to date . it sees players stepping into the shoes of Hinako Shimizu, a high school girl in rural 1960s . her parents control every aspect of her life, and her only escape is in the comfort of her childhood friends .

title: MLB insiders predict the playoffs: Bold takes, dangerous teams and breakout stars
content: our baseball insiders are ready to break down the biggest questions, latest news and notable buzz across the industry . what is the boldest prediction we've heard from an MLB exec? will the Toronto Blue Jays and Milwaukee Brewers turn stellar regular seasons into deep playoff runs?

title: NFL betting buzz: Colts flying up odds boards amid hot start
content: our betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories that are driving the conversation . the Colts have covered the spread in every game, making them one of only two 3-0 ATS teams in the league along with thailand .

title: Not who we thought they were: Five nice surprises and three early-season letdowns
content: the season has kicked off but there's still time to start fresh with a 0-0 record . there are also players who didn't find their way onto the fantasy radar in July and August . they are the ones producing weekly numbers and working their way into fantasy lineups .

title: Alex Morgan aims for the same heights in business as on-field success
content: "i was like OK, it's out there. Now I'm going to enjoy it," she tells ESPN . she was the face of the u.s. women's national team and arguably the most famous female athlete globally for over a decade .

title: Coaches outmaneuver NFL's defenses with court ruling on arbitration
content: two separate courts have ruled in favor of coaches' challenges to arbitration requirements . one panel labeled the league's arbitration process "unconscionable" and another called it "unworthy even of the name of arbitration" a spokesman did not provide comment, but legal analysts say the court decisions are likely to have a wider impact on the power dynamic between the league and its employees .

title: 💍 D'Angelo Russell gets engaged to girlfriend
content: Dallas Mavericks  point guard  D'Angelo Russell  is officially engaged. Russell's now-fiancée, Laura Ivaniukas announced their engagement Tuesday with a joint post on Instagram captioned: "Ms to Mrs.. Loading," seemingly referencing the  nickname he has embraced  since being drafted in 2015 by the  Los Angeles Lakers . A post shared by Laura Ivaniukas (@laura.iva) According to  People , Russell and Ivaniukas met at a New York Fashion Week event before eventually going public with their relationship in 2020. The couple have two children together. They welcomed son Riley Russell in 2022 and daughter Mila-Rose Russell in 2024. Russell agreed to a  two-year, $13 million deal  with the Mavericks in June, with the second season in the deal being a player option. He averaged 12.6 points, 2.8 rebounds and 5.1 assists with the Lakers and  Brooklyn Nets  in 2024-25. The Nets acquired Russell from the Lakers in a January deal. He is heading into his ninth NBA season.

title: College football September transfer surprises
content: the best players available in college football's transfer portal are making millions . talent evaluation is still the name of the game during the portal season . this is not exactly an early all-transfer team; we'll get to that later in the season.

title: Power Rankings: Guardians rise, Mets and Tigers fall ahead of playoffs
content: the Tigers, Guardians, Mets, Reds and Diamondbacks fall into the playoffs . the Mets hold a slight one-game lead over Cincinnati and Arizona for the final wild-card spot . a late losing skid highlighted their second-half woes and put their playoff spot in the final .

title: Caleb Williams, Isaiah Rodgers join Madden NFL 26 Team of the Week 3
content: totw is a program that runs alongside the season and delivers weekly content releases featuring athletes who've had standout performances in the previous week's games . the champions and heroes categories feature players such as the Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown , Cleveland Browns running back Quinshon Judkins , and Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end T. J. Watt .

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: team USA captain Keegan Bradley and team Europe captain Luke Donald are both eager and ready for the 2025 Ryder Cup to begin Friday . the first match of the day will go off at 7:10 a.m. the parings for the first four matches will be announced Thursday afternoon .
